title: So, burst>dps, dps>tank, and tank>burst.
body: That is how the game is supposed to work, but adc's break this triangle because they do bps (burst per second).

replies.body: Put a adc out by himself against any kind of burst champion 1v1, they die.

 {{item:3072}} 20% more health to survive burst
{{item:3046}} 12% damage migitation

You should be buying {{item:3124}} {{item:3115}} {{item:3089}}

As someone who has been playing AP {{champion:110}} in mid for a while. I think {{item:3124}} is a waste. He does better at 100-0'ing anyone his ult touches late game so more AP and burst are preferred. My core items are always {{item:3146}} {{item:3135}} {{item:3089}}

I take it for the flexibility. 
It allows me to swap to AD if the ADC falls behind, but it also helps with getting all 4 possible triple procs. 
In fact, i actually go {{item:3124}} when i'm playing ADC varus, because it's so gold efficient and you scale perfectly with it... Like a glove.

Though generally i do take {{item:3146}} first into {{item:3085}}. I just prefer the farming, healing, and multi-targeting for team fights. 
But i do also get {{item:3089}} {{item:3135}} which is generally what brings me up to doing about 40% with my 3 stack W.

Also, why didnt the mage kill the adc before they could get close enough to auto them? Most mages have hard cc, even lux's root has more range than an adc, bonus if the adc is walking up to auto a mage.

I've noticed that over the past year as my ADC improves. I really do think the only way to fix it would be to remove crit. It scales too hard into the late game and breaks the curve. I kinda think ADCs should just have a much more intense AD per level stat so that they can end the game with say 350 or 400 AD normally, but without gritting for a extra 600. People like Darius do fuck tons of damage with just autos later, it should be kinda like that button a ranged champion.
